arm_group.description: Patients undergo a first evaluation, and a second evaluation one month later to determine their natural evolution.  The following month, patients get 12 sessions of rhythmic therapy.  A third evaluation is organized straight after this month and a fourth evaluation, 3 months after to assess the after-effects of the therapy.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether rhythmic upper-limb movement training in
      post-stroke patients allows to improve only this particular type of movements or if it also
      improves some parameters of discrete movements.  Based on our results we hope to be able to
      answer a fundamental question: are rhythmic and discrete movements two independent
      primitives?

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Rhythmic Upper-limb Training in Stroke Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  more than 6 months post-stroke patients

          -  Fugl-Meyer between 7 and 55

          -  Maintain the same intensity of rehabilitation during the study

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  cerebellar   stroke

          -  severe aphasia or cognitive disorder

          -  any other neurological disorder

intervention.description: Stroke patients have 12 rehabilitation sessions on a planar rehabilitation robot, Reaplan, focussed on rhythmic arm movements.
Evaluation of the stability of the patients during one month before the rhythmic therapy
Evaluation of the after effects of the rhythmic therapy, three months follow-up

primary_outcome.description:
Patients are asked to fulfill rhythmic movements on the end-effector robot Reaplan. The smoothness is assessed with following metrics:
number of peaks in velocity profile
TENT value
logarithmic dimensionless square jerk
primary_outcome.measure: Change in movement smoothness in rhythmic straight movements after one month of rhythmic therapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week to 1 day before therapy and 1 day to 1 week after therapy

primary_outcome.description:
Patients are asked to fulfill discrete movements on the end-effector robot Reaplan. The smoothness is assessed with following metrics:
number of peaks in velocity profile
TENT value
logarithmic dimensionless square jerk
primary_outcome.measure: Change in movement smoothness in discrete straight movements after one month of rhythmic therapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week to 1 day before therapy and 1 day to 1 week after therapy

primary_outcome.description: Patients are asked to fulfill discrete movements on the end-effector robot Reaplan. The accuracy is assessed.
primary_outcome.measure: Change in accuracy of discrete straight movements after one month of rhythmic therapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week to 1 day before therapy and 1 day to 1 week after therapy

primary_outcome.description: Patients are asked to fulfill 10 circular movements on the end-effector robot Reaplan. The movement smoothness are assessed
primary_outcome.measure: Change in smoothness of rhythmic circular movement after rhythmic therapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day to 1 week before therapy and 1day to 1 week after therapy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
Upper limb Fugl-Meyer Assessment
Box and block test
Ashworth test
secondary_outcome.measure: Change of the general motricity of the patient due to one month rhythmic therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week to 1 day before therapy and 1 day to 1 week after therapy

secondary_outcome.description: Evolution of the movement smoothness in rhythmic and discrete movements, the movement accuracy in discrete movements and the general motricity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day to one week after therapy and 3 months after therapy

secondary_outcome.description: Natural evolution of the movement smoothness in rhythmic and discrete movements, of the accuracy in discrete movements and of the general motricity of the patient
secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the natural evolution of the patient
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 to 5 weeks before therapy and 1 week to 1 day before therapy

clinical_study.source: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

lead_sponsor.agency: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
